article: I liked climbing things when I was a baby. My mother remembers and has told me most of those _ moments like this one. When I was one and a half years old, we lived in our first house in Rue St-Louis. On a hot summer day, my father intended to _ the roof of our old house. In order to climb up there, he _ In my town, _ could walk outside because the streets were _ . I was outside watching my father climb on that strange thing. I was curious about why my father disappear at last. So I decided to go up it to figure out why it was impossible to see my father after he reached the _ of that thing. At 1.5 years old, still a baby wearing pampers, I climbed that ladder to the roof top and started walking _ . My father did not notice that-he was on the other side occupied with his repairs. It happened that a nice lady in our _ passed by and _ me. The nice lady came to my house and _ my mother of it, who was fearful and _ ran outside to speak with me. She really thought I would just fall off that roof, for I was just a baby after all . She asked me to sit down and stop moving in a _ way you speak to your babies when they are cute. _ , I threw myself flat on the _ and waited. My mother climbed the ladder to _ me up and there I was enjoying the view laughing at my mother's shocked face. _ the saying goes, "He who knows nothing _ nothing."
